ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: About 2-3, except towards the end when the final product is due.
2-5 hours?
2-6, depending on the assignment for the week
8 hours per week
3-5 depending on your writing/working efficiency
4 on average, some weeks 2, other weeks 6-7
Depending on the week, but probably average of 4

2, but it should have been more if I had done the assigned readings before class. I feel like because I was in five other classes and the readings weren't stressed, that is why I didn't do them. If I had more time, though, I would have.
No more than 5 hours per week typically.

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: The course was great, the strengths was the set up. We were assigned to our groups throughout the length of the semester, which allowed us to be comfortable with everyone early on. Marney also allowed us class time to work with our groups, which helped dramatically. Discussions were helpful and relevant to our projects. I see no weaknesses in this course.

Great course. Learned a lot about questionnaire development. Some of the lectures could be combined at the beginning to give an extra week for SPSS during the data analysis phase. The first session in lab could be Dr. White doing SPSS on the projector showing us basic things. The next two weeks could be data analysis as it was this year.
Fine

AMAZING COURSE!! It was fun working in groups creating a questionnaire on a topic that interested us. The class had a good structure: half of it lecture, the other half working in groups. This class is very much learning by doing.
I loved making a questionnaire. It was a practical skill and I felt like I really had to think about our project rather than do a bunch of busy work.

This class was so much fun! I really enjoyed learning through doing. It was great to learn something in lecture and then immediately practice through our own questionnaire. The only weakness I can think of is that what you get out of this class probably depends on the group you work with for the semester, so if you choose a group that doesn't work well together, that could be a problem.

This is a great course, however, there were too many students and the groups were very large, making it hard to coordinate and also to learn. I did not get to spend as much time learning SPSS as we chose to divide and conquer and I ended up just working on a description of our measurement scale. Groups should be smaller if possible.

I enjoyed this course! I really liked the structure of the class and how each week's topic build upon the previous week. To improve this course, I would suggest spending more time on the data analysis section of the course. It seems like we sped through that part of the class and a lot of students were learning SPSS for the first time. We had to rely on group members who were more familiar with SPSS to lead the analysis part of the project. It would have been great if an optional SPSS 101 workshop would have been offered at some point during the semester to prepare us for the data analysis section. Also, it was slightly difficult to find files on our Canvas class site, so I would suggest organizing Canvas a bit better. Overall, great course!
Amazing course. It's helpful to have a topic in mind as you go in, and supporting yourself with a reliable and productive group with shared goal.

This course was a great introduction to questionnaire development and its use in research. Group project based, and group project deadlines were coordinated in order to illustrate the material presented in class - this was excellent, as it gave the course a very practical application and illustrated how one might use questionnaires in research and academics.

I really appreciated how this course directly developed applicable skills in developing scales to measure various psychometric qualities. I see this as an important skill to have in my future research and feel like this is one of the only courses where I left feeling like I had accomplished work that could be published. Dr. White structured the course in a way that offered effective pacing of the course concepts and the tasks were ordered cumulatively to match the process that one would normally use to develop such scales. I am so glad to have taken this course and refined these skills and am excited to move forward with the project I started here.
It's fantastic to see the stats applied in QD, I loved my group, and Marney creates a great enviroment for learning.

This course was good. Marney was such a personable professor, and learning how to write a questionnaire was such a great skill to gain. The teamwork component of this class was also a critical component of the class. A weakness of the course is that I sometimes didn't know what was going on. Concepts could have been explained better.

Very practical in terms of the skill set it develops. The set-up of the assignments are also such that you learn as you do them. Very group-centeered, so it's fun if you are with a good group of people who are invested!
A great class to take if interested in questionnaire development or thinking of adding developing surveys to your research toolkit
This course was extremely useful. It took us through the entire process of developing, editing, testing, and evaluating a questionnaire.

Although it is very important, I believe questionnaire development is a skill that is often overlooked. The class was very helpful in that it highlighted all the different things to consider when creating a questionnaire in order to achieve high reliability and validity.
Excellent
Amazing course! The material helps students understand the complexities of formulating a survey and is very beneficial to know as a future public health practitioner.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Marney A. White  Marney is great, so intelligent, kind, and willing to help. She truly loves teaching and it shows in the way she treats and respects her students. I appreciate and enjoyed everything Marney did and see no weaknesses in her teaching method.
Instructor: Marney A. White  Fantastic. Always accessible to students and very accommodating. Provides great and immediate feedback on all assignments.
Instructor: Marney A. White  Marney is incredible!! She really cares about the success of her students and is a great mentor for any YSPH student to have!

Instructor: Marney A. White  Marney is incredible. I am so lucky to have taken my second class with her. She's really invested in your success and the success of your product and is willing to answer any of your questions. She has a lot of experience with this field.

Instructor: Marney A. White  Marney is fantastic! She is incredibly dynamic and excited about the course, which made it enjoyable to go to class. Further, she is extremely responsive and helpful when responding to student questions and I felt that our group was very supported throughout the whole process. The class moves quickly but I felt like she never asked anything unreasonable of us and respected how much work we put in by turning around assignments quickly and giving high quality feedback. I wish she taught more classes here, I would take all of them.
Instructor: Marney A. White  Dr. White is wonderful. She is very approachable, accommodating, and humorous. I love that she manages to be an effective teacher without giving us loads of busy-work.

Instructor: Marney A. White  All around fantastic human being and instructor. Marney is beyond considerate and is very much invested in every students well being. YSPH should feel humbled to have such an incredible person to serve this institution.

Instructor: Marney A. White  Marney is awesome! She provides a lot of insightful feedback on our assignments, made the lectures really interesting, and is also really funny -- overall great instructor!

Instructor: Marney A. White  Incredibly personable, and made the material accessible. The way in which the course was designed was thoughtful and fluid. Marney is one of my favorite professors I have ever had for her attention to detail, quick pace, and overall effectiveness in delivering content.
Instructor: Marney A. White  The best, by far. Champions and supports students. Not all courses equip you with resources so that you are successful in a project-based course, but this course does!

Instructor: Marney A. White  Very interactive and effective speaker as well as group discussion coordinator. In this setting of a group project dictating most of grade of course, her communication was key to ensuring everyone was on track for the completion of their projects and for assuring a standard of quality for the projects, and the professor clearly navigated that without difficulty, even in a year with a higher than usual number of groups.
Instructor: Marney A. White  Very good, the instructor is very helpful.

Instructor: Marney A. White  The instructor provided an excellent balance of humor and content in each class. I felt like I learned so much from each lecture. More importantly, I feel like Dr. White was dedicated to the learning process over the grading process, something other instructors have faltered around. Ultimately, this is why, in my opinion, I learned more (instead of memorizing more only to forget it immediately after the class). I really appreciated all of the time Dr. White took to offer constructive feedback on our projects so as to push us to do better and be successful.
Instructor: Marney A. White  I love how creative and passionate she is -- one of my favorite YSPH professors! Very approachable too

Instructor: Marney A. White  Marney is a passionate, animate, and fun professor. She can make any topic interesting and draws in students. I think that Marney could explain harder concepts, such as a test's reliability and validity, a little bit better. I sometimes felt lost.
Instructor: Marney A. White  Brilliant. Kind, firm, great at relaying material in understandable format.

Instructor: Marney A. White  Dr. White always gave us feedback as soon as possible; always willing to discuss our project with us; It would be great if Dr. White could talk slower especially when walking us through lectures on data analysis
Instructor: Marney A. White  Great instructor
Instructor: Marney A. White  Professor White was attentive and helpful throughout the whole process and really was passionate about each of our projects.

Instructor: Marney A. White  Marney is amazing! She always knew how to get us excited about developing a questionnaire from the beginning to the very end. She was very helpful in terms of answering questions, and always challenged us to dig deeper in our analyses.
Instructor: Marney A. White  Excellent. So enthusiastic and incredibly responsive and quick with feedback.

Instructor: Marney A. White  Marney is one of the most kind, intelligent, and dedicated professors at YSPH. She truly cares about her students and explains the methodologies of developing a questionnaire with a fun and engaging spirit.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Absolutely, while it's a course on creating effective questionnaires, it actually applies much further than just that. The concepts learned in this course are useful for a variety of reasons and I would absolutely recommend.
Definitely recommend. Good skill to have. You should make sure to pick a good group since most of the assignments are group-based.
Definitely worth taking this class! By the end, you will be a survey expert, thanks to Marney!

I would highly recommend this. Marney is an amazing professor and she teaches you actually useful skills that will be needed in any field. You learn SPSS so well as well has analytical methods. The class was engaging and fun and she was an entertaining professor. One of my best classes taken at Yale so far.

This was a great course and incredibly useful. I'm a PhD student and find that we don't have that many skills based classes here at YSPH, but this class was so well designed and executed that I feel like a have a real solid foundation in questionnaire development and that I will able to apply these methods directly to my research. So glad I took this class!

In this course you learn about questionnaire development by spending the entire semester creating, revising, piloting, and validating a questionnaire. I definitely recommend this course! It is fun and relevant.
You learn every step of developing a questionnaire for research or public health practice. Highly recommend this course!
One of the most rewarding and engaged courses I've taken at ysph by far!
A must-take for every student interested in working with questionnaires as part of research or future job. highly recommend

If you're at all interested in developing questionnaires, take this course! You will not be disappointed. Dr. White makes each lecture entertaining as well as educational and offers a great opportunity to do publishable research work.
A must- take! I now look at every question asked of me differently, and any reported survey stats I feel like I can question in an informed way
This course was a great way to learn how to develop a questionnaire! Concepts could have been explained a little better, but overall, a great course!
I would recommend it, because you walk away with a great skill and the experience is enjoyable
Yes, I would. A very fun and useful class to take!
Great course! Would definitely recommend if you are interested in making effective questionnaires/surveys.
I think that this class is extremely useful and that questionnaire development skill that more people should have some experience in before entering any work field.
Excellent. A must-take for anyone interested in survey-based research.
